one_reviews_text:
Interesting Visuals create a memorable (short) experience. 
The only thing missing is a real end.
...other than that, what the cheezwiz is Alice Cooper doing in there?

I liked the world but you dont have to much things to interact with, neither the lanscape, it would be better some music and a travel by Dali world.
The images are not soft so in every move u can see an unstable view.
This is so surreal and so Dali,I really love the immense landscape,could just sit and relax while taking it all in.

review_title: I'm a big Dali fan so I loved this!
one_reviews_text: I hope you add onto this! Ill be keeping my eye out for more content! It was short but it made me want to see more!

I was fortunate to experience this at the Dali Museum in Saint Petersburg Florida. I was with my brother and his wife and they were able to experience a little bit of VR. Cool.  They loved it.I downloaded the app hoping for more. There wasn't. That said it was a cool 5 minutes.
Nice detour into a slower parallel universe. Loved it.

There just isn't much to see here, it's as if an art history student in college made this as their final. It doesn't fully explore the artist's life or seek anything more from his work than just a few simple set pieces.
It's free! It's worth playing just to see the amazing giant elephant spider things! So trippy!

I’m not sure why people didn’t like this. The distant voice over is a nice touch, and I liked the dayglo, um, whomever he was. There were long-legged elephants that will walk right over you like something from Star Wars and some odd characters. A little bit spooky in some parts and blasting up the towers is fun. Not sure if I really got a deeper appreciation of Dali’s work, but it was still enjoyable.

Environment is awesome, teleport to several viewpoints marked by white globes.
Would be cool to have some freedom to move, but this app is very optimized , small download for the content.
Limiting to teleport and just look around at each spot eliminates the need for collision models and keeps the focus on viewing the artwork. Thank you !

Daly has some of the bizarrest worlds in his paintings, restricting this to the most bland creations of Dali and just some fixed view points is a waste,  maybe in the future if the devs add full locomotion and expand this to more of the Dali's work may be worth to experience, but for now, no way, there are a lot better free experiences than this.
Check it out

review_title: Great for a first time VR experience!
one_reviews_text:
This is one of the better free tech demos that I've come across. It's beautiful, not to intense, easy to navigate, and also very easy to restart from the beginning if you wish to switch viewers. The image clarity is very good with little to no blur. Dali is so surreal and interesting that his vision translates great to a VR space.

The only thing that pulls this down to a four-star review for me is the limiting of movement. If there were to be implemented some simple locomotives to move around the world a bit more freely utilizing the touch with this it twould make the experience one of the best tech demos.

Still a four-star and, in my opinion, a must have!
About 15 minutes worth of WTF...?

It was too short, but can't really complain cause it's free. This was definitely different than any of the other VR experiences. I can see this becoming a popular way for all types of artists to showcase their work. That includes musicians in possibly a laser light show format etc.
Not much to see, the rendering isn't very competently done, and you constantly have to turn ~180° to progress to other points.

review_title: Do you have be tripping on mushrooms
one_reviews_text: To enjoy this VR experience?  Because I have no idea what that was.  There's some weird audio going on in the background.  You teleport by looking at these white balls.  Then at some point, you see a lobster trying to answer a phone that keeps ringing.  You then teleport high above these towers.  Then finally, you get to these elephants that look like they are walking on stilts or maybe they have gigantic cricket legs.  WTF?

If you aren't culturally ignorant like the negative reviewer below, then you will likely be familiar with Dali and his work, and won't find this a "confusing" experience.

It's a creative concept, but I'm hoping this is very early access because there isn't much to it at this point.  Nevertheless, if the idea of stepping into a Dali painting appeals to you, this is worth checking out while it's free.  

To the devs: you need to add controller support so people can point and click on the balls instead of having to stare at them.
Beautiful and strange environment, much as you would expect. Also the usual basic flaw of having moving creatures (elephants) with rubbish, inorganic animation.

review_title: Couldn't move past the second waypoint
one_reviews_text: Looks promising. Unfortunately I couldn't get past the second waypoint; looking at the next white ball didn't 'activate it'. Also the audio sounded badly muffled; the conversation between father and son (?) wasn't comprehensible.

I like the fidelity in this, it looks a lot better than a free app should. It has some lovely Dali imagary, the main moving animals are really good.

Only downsides are that the audio of Dali talking in the background is very quiet and you can hardly understand any of it, and the teleportation nodes are a bit big and obtrusive.
Small but perfectly formed Dali-esque experience.  Weird and wonderful graphics.

I loved the visualization...but it was certainly too short, and it could become so much better. If updates ever come out for this to include more of his works I will increase my star rating and update my review -- For now it gets a solid 3, and is worth a free install.

I thought I would like it, but it has very little content and the way to explore the environment is not the best. I think an automatic low-speed air ride would be better. But it's worth it to use at least once. It's free.
the fact that someone took the time to introduce me to the prospect to introduce me to Dali's art.  I'm ecstatic.   thank you to whomever did this
Just need 4k texture and high res mesh to be good
Do not waste your time downloading I cant believe Oculus actually think this is okay to be on the store.
This is an absolutly offensive piece of crap. Avoid!
No matter how long I hover the dot over the title, nothing happens. I couldn't find any "spheres" to hover over instead so couldn't get it to start.
